metadata.title: CVE-2024-26817 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: amdkfd:use calloc instead of kzalloc to avoid integer overflow This uses callocinstead of doing the multiplication which might overflow.

criterions.comment: linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
